1.content:
'Quick; this must be prepared for dinner immediately!' The head chef shouted, 'it is only an hour until serving; HURRY UP!'; you heard the head chef panicking in the kitchen for the 6th time this week; the kings food demands were getting bigger as his belly got bigger. People were charging around taking plates out and sweeping the floors and washing up pans that needed to be done.

'YOU BOY!' the head chef shouted at you, you walked over to him 'ummm ye...yes sir?', 'I need you to go to the kings chambers and explain that dinner preparations have fallen behind schedule and that it will be another hour'; your heart pounded, you had never been up to the kings chamber before and to tell him such news may get him angry. 'Ye...yes of course sir' you say and bow to the head chef.

On your way out of the kitchens you see a spare plate layered with fruits, cheeses, some cold meats and bread. You grab it and run out of the kitchen and ascend the stairs towards the kings chambers. You know at this time the queen is out at this time as she usually is on a Saturday evening and the King would be eating on his own.

You pass some armed guards and explain that you have to bare news to the king. Arriving at the large doors you nervously knock lightly expecting the king not to hear you.

'Enter' you heard a voice speak from the other side; slightly muffled by the thickness of the door. As you enter the door is closed behind you. You walk through the large entrance and turn a corner to see a lavishly laid out room filled with gorgeous silks and satin's and large wooden furniture. The King is nowhere to be seen; you lay the plate down on the table and look up to see a large painting of the king in his youth; short brown hair and chiseled features and a large muscular body; topped with the crown and wrapped in quite revealing clothes; tight trousers and a shirt that opens up from the chest upwards.

You stand there for a moment looking at the painting and imagining the King as he is now; when suddenly someone puts there hand on your shoulder, making you jump.

Who is it?

11.content:
You stand there for a moment looking at the painting and imagining the King as he is now; when suddenly someone puts there hand on your shoulder, making you jump. 'Oh my apologies!' you turn to see the king stood there in all his beauty. You notice he is wearing the same clothes as in the painting but without the crown and a much tighter attire; his belly pushes firmly against the top and you can just see the top of it through the gap at the chest. His hair although still brown was now a lighter brown in parts due to age and his face, although still handsome showed signs of wrinkles around the eyes.

'N....no the fault is mine sire, I came to bring news on your dinner but found myself snooping around your royal chambers' you said whilst bowing. The king laughed 'that is quite alright young one; now rise' the king says placing his hand back on your shoulder. You rise and smile at the king; 'now what is this news of my dinner?' the king asked

'Well; it shall be an hour late I'm afraid....bu...but I thought you may not be able to wait that long and have brought you a snack' You say and point to the plate covered in foods on the table.

'Why; how thoughtful of you! I give you my thanks.' The King says; you stand there in silence for a moment; 'come sit, sit' the King says and gestures you to the chair you are stood near. Not wanting to disobey the king you take the seat and he takes the one opposite you.

'So how goes things my boy?' The King asks; as he takes three slices of meat and shovels them into his mouth;

'Oh umm, very well thank you sir' you say, transfixed on the kings eating habits, as he takes a bite out of the large piece of bread

'Good; because I would want you to tell me if any bad happens or if anything I can do to help you in anyway, I know your upbringing was very difficult and I'd like to help out in someway' the king says, you feel incredibly touched by this; that the King wanted to help you personally. You watch again as he wraps the cheeses in meat and stuff them into his mouth. He then proceeds to grab the grape bunch and put the whole thing in his mouth, he pulls it out slowly completely bare of grapes, sits back and lets out a satisfied burp. You smile and look up at the painting, the king notices this and laughs 'hard to believe its the same person sat in front of you eh?' The King says; patting his belly.

'N...no....well....I mean....that is to say' You say nervously; the king laughs again 'don't worry lad; it is my doing'

'Well, if I didn't know who you were and I saw the comparison, then it would be hard to believe, but knowing who you are. It suits you deeply' You said and instantly covered your mouth. The king raised his eyebrow at your statement and the two of you remained quiet for a time.

'Do you have any other duties this evening?' The King asked; You instantly felt low, you let slip something so stupid and now the King was kicking you out after his loving hospitality 'ummmm....ye....yes sire' you say

'Well not anymore you don't; you officially have the evening off, I shall be asking the staff to bring the food up here if you care to join me? I mean with the Queen out till tomorrow evening, the company would be most grand' the King said, 'yes!' you say instantly; the King laughs 'I...mean, that would be fantastic, thank you my lord!' You say. 'Not at all' the King says, he proceeds to stand up and walk to the chamber doors, he starts talking to one of the guards outside and re-enters. You can't help but notice the fullness of his belly already.

The king looks at you 'the feast shall be on its way'

112.content:
"Tell me boy about your parents. What were they like?" asked the King.

"I don't remember much, but my mother and father worked on a farm. Before they passed away they used to let me play with the animals." you say comforted by the King's fatherly tone.

"I see that they truly loved you. If it wasn't for my daughter, Marissa then we wouldn't have found you. Yet she's always been an adventurous young lady." said the King as he looked at a painting of him and Marissa.

"How is Marissa?" you ask.

"She's fine. She still can't decide who to marry. Yet word has spread that she likes a certain someone." said the King in a joking manner.

The thought makes you blush. It was almost too hard for you to believe. Yet it does make sense since she has been acting weird around you lately. Yet the idea of being a son of the King made your heart almost skip a beat.

"So you're the one that she likes. I can see why she likes you. Out of all the servants you are the most well-built. It's no wonder why the servant girls giggle when they see you." said the King.

There is then a knock on the door.

"Come in." said the King.

'Now. Let us feast!' The king said as he pulled the cart over and began to feed, you watch in awe as the king gobbles up chicken, beef, fish, fruit and cheeses. info.brief_description: You are a servant for the King of Averen; the kings weight gain means big things for you.
info.description:
It had just been the Kings 43rd birthday and 20th year on the throne. The whole kingdom rejoiced at this double event; and the king threw on a large feast to mark the occasion. People came from all around to join in with the celebrations.

you a young man; were born two days after the kings coronation and now you work in the castle as a servant and got to be in the kings party first hand. Your parents died when you were 6 years old and you were taken in by a servant of the castle. Growing up there you witnessed many things but mostly the kindness of the king. He was kind to all his servants and upon your 16th birthday he granted you an audience with him at his table for dinner. You watched as the king made a pig of himself and it interested you greatly. Much to your delight (and the queens dismay) four years later, it appears this piggish eating was started to catch up with him; and all you wanted to see was the King get fatter.
